result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel P. Rechlin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Criminal Case Settlement
with elements and JI

[MK] cases #15CF224 and #14CM238 called at 2:22pm. 
Defendant Daniel P. Rechlin in court with Attorney John V Rhiel.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On Motion of the State, the Court amends Case #15CF224-to add Count #5 to Class A Misdemeanor Battery as a Party to A Crime contrary to Statute 910.19(1) and Statute 939.05.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered on Case #15CF224-Count #5 and Case #14CM238-Count #2; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified-ADA Hall submits the victim restitution packet of information; the Court accepts the pleas, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.
As to case #15CM238, the Domestic Abuse finding is made.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses the remaining counts in the cases.

On both Case #15CF224-Count #5 and Case #14CM238-Count #2 each, the Court withholds sentence, and places Mr. Rechlin on Probation for two years, with conditions:

--to undergo anger management or certified batterer's intervention counseling, one or the other in the discretion of the Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, and counseling as required by the Agent
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no contact with Justin Allen except through a lawyer
--to make restitution of $1,898.35 to Blue Cross-Blue Shield of Texas, located in Chicago IL 
--to pay the 10% restitution processing fee 
--to reimburse the balance due for Court-appointed attorney fees
--to pay costs and surcharges
 including the DNA surcharge in each case

--in Case #15CF224 only:  to comply with DNA sample provision
 --in Case #15CF224 only:  to pay subpoena fees of $132 

Days credit for time already served:  1 day on each case
recess 2:43pm.

Notice of intent to admit statements w/cover letter

Case called at 2:12pm [mo]
Defendant Daniel P. Rechlin in court.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ reviews case history.
Mr. Rechlin indicates that he does not qualify for PD representation. Further, Mr. Rechlin indicates that he has a Petition for Court Appointed Counsel.
The Court reviews the Petition with Mr. Rechlin.
THe Court grants Mr. Rechlin's Petition for Court Appointed Counsel
The Court orders that case 14CM238 follow with this case also, so it is to be scheduled for stc with 15CF224.
The Court also appoints Counsel to Case 14CM238 on behalf of Mr. Rechlin

Case called at 1:26 pm [sf]
Defendant Daniel P. Rechlin in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert appearing for the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Dahnert advises that she appears for SPD for bond purposes only.
Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Address and DOB information verified or DOB verified
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, maximum penalties recited
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $5,000.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No acts or threats of violence 
-No contact with Justin Allen, Tyler Renz or Brandon Hans

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

Recess: 1:30 pm
